The 52-week low is the lowest price at which a security has traded during the time period that equates to one year and is viewed as a technical indicator.
The 52-week high is the highest price at which a security has traded during the time period that equates to one year and is viewed as a technical indicator.

column5: is the market value of a publicly traded company's outstanding shares. Market capitalization is equal to the share price multiplied by the number of shares outstanding.

Description: The SEC filing is a financial statement or other formal document submitted to the U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission. Public companies
